articles.summary: The condition of environmentally-sensitive areas in Northern Ireland is declining, according to a new report. The report was released by the Northern Ireland Environmental Protection Agency (NEPPA). NEPPA has no immediate comment on the report.

articles.title: Tropical forests struggling to keep pace with climate change: study
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Tropical forests in the Americas are struggling to keep pace with climate change. University of Adelaide lecturer Sami Rifai warns that by 2100, temperatures could rise by a lot more than normal. He says tree communities are responding too slowly to remain in equilibrium with their environment.

articles.title: Betting on future forest carbon storage endangers Paris Agreement targets
articles.author: Mongabay
articles.summary: Banking on the capacity of global forests to continue storing carbon could put the Paris Agreement climate targets out of reach and incur huge economic costs, according to a new modeling study. Accelerated decarbonization could meet climate objectives despite forest carbon losses due to disturbances.

articles.title: Consecutive El Niños are happening more often and the result is more devastating
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: El Niño is one of the largest drivers of variability in the global climate. Every few years, the tropical eastern Pacific Ocean seesaws between warm (El Niño) and cold (La Niña) phases. This reshuffles rainfall patterns, unleashing floods, droughts and storms thousands of miles away.

articles.title: Van Drew friend of fishermen
articles.author: Atlantic City
articles.summary: My husband is one of many fishermen who risk their lives to put food on America's tables. He works long, dangerous hours at sea and the challenges he faces are only growing as offshore wind projects are being fast-tracked. He is worried about the dangers he faces.

articles.title: Trump imposes tariffs on uninhabited islands near Antarctica
articles.author: The News International
articles.summary: Donald Trump has hit a group of volcanic islands near Antarctica with a trade war message. The islands are home to penguins and are covered in glaciers and covered with glaciers, so they are vulnerable to Donald Trump's trade war with the United States.

articles.title: ‘Doom loops' are accelerating climate change – but we can break them
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: The extent of Arctic winter sea ice in March 2025 was the lowest ever. Close to half of the world's people have little defence against deadly heat due to climate change, according to Surasak Jailak's report.  .

articles.title: Europe continues to go green as the going gets tough
articles.author: The Editorial
articles.summary: The threat of global warming has plenty of competition these days, with the US causing geopolitical disorder, Russia still waging its war of conquest and far-right populism on the rise, distractions from the fight against climate change, writes Bloomberg Opinion's editorial board.

articles.title: ‘Immense consequences': Trump's tariffs ignite worldwide backlash, global recession fears
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: 'Dire consequences' for millions of people, world leaders warn, as US allies across Europe and Asia consider next moves. US allies in Europe and in Asia are considering next moves against the US. US President Barack Obama is worried about the consequences for his allies.

articles.title: Whales migrations changed as seas warmed. But can they keep pace with climate change?
articles.author: North Shore News
articles.summary: Study on the migration of humpback whales warns of climate change and the risk of entanglement with fishing equipment and being hit by a boat. 42 whales were tagged off the Central and South American coasts and the study was published in the journal Scientific Reports.

articles.title: President Trump Imposes Tariffs on Islands Inhabited by Penguins
articles.author: Greek Reporter
articles.summary: Heard Island and McDonald islands are an external territory of Australia. They are uninhabited, volcanic islands near Antarctica covered in glaciers and inhabited only by penguins. Australia will charge them half of what they are charging them now, so the tariffs will be not a full reciprocal.

articles.title: Traffic noise turns Galápagos warblers into angry birds
articles.author: Mongabay
articles.summary: Traffic noise in the Galápagos Islands can make songbirds aggressive, according to a recent study. The islands have seen a rise in road infrastructure and traffic in recent decades. Researchers wanted to understand how birds react to the noise in order to better understand their behaviour.

articles.author: Citizen Times

articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Conditions are set to become too hot and dry for carbon-storing peat to form, research shows, as the heat and dry weather will make it harder for peat formation.      .   in the near future.

articles.title: Forecasters predict active Atlantic hurricane season. See odds of a hurricane hitting RI
articles.author: The Providence Journal
articles.summary: There could be as many as 17 hurricanes in the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season. The Gulf Coast and the Carolinas are most at-risk of getting hit by hurricanes. The temperature is not as warm as it was last year at this time, so the chances of hurricanes are higher.

articles.title: ‘Very high to extreme' risk of wildfires in UK this weekend, Scottish fire service warns
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Crews are tackling a grass fire at Gartur Moss in Stirling as wildfires continue to break out in southern England. The fire is caused by a recent wildfire in the southern part of the country. The cause of the fire is still unknown.

articles.title: Global warming of more than 3 degrees C this century may wipe 40% off the world's economy: analysis
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Climate change will have a negative impact on the global economy by the end of the century. Global warming affects economies in many ways, most obvious is damage from extreme weather. Future climate change will increase the risk of weather shocks occurring simultaneously across countries. This will disrupt the networks producing and delivering goods, compromise trade and limit the extent to which countries help each other.

articles.title: Activist walks from Canada to LA
articles.summary: Robin Greenfield walked from Canada to Los Angeles and gave away everything he owns as an experiment in non-ownership. He's calling it an experiment.    "A Journey of Non-Ownership" by Robin Greenfield is an environmental activist.

articles.title: Australia sweats through hottest 12 months on record: official data
articles.author: DAVID GRAY
articles.summary: Australia has just sweltered through its hottest 12 months on record, a weather official said Thursday. The rolling 12-month period between April 2024 and March 2025 was 1.61 degrees Celsius (34.9 degrees Fahrenheit) above average. It is the hottest since records began more than a century ago.

articles.title: Experts warn 'AI-written' paper is latest spin on climate change denial
articles.author: Lionel BONAVENTURE
articles.summary: Climate change deniers are pushing an AI-generated paper questioning human-induced global warming. The paper has been widely cited on social media as being the first "peer-reviewed" research led by artificial intelligence (AI) on the topic. Experts warn against the rise of research marketed as neutral and scrupulously logical.

articles.title: UnDisciplined: Climate phases can predict crop yields. So, why aren't we using that knowledge?
articles.summary: El Niño and La Niña climate cycles can impact regional crop yields. Agro-climatologist Weston Anderson says we haven't done a great job of thinking at a planetary scale about farming in a world where the food system is increasingly global. He says we need to integrate this knowledge into farming decisions.

articles.title: ROD MCGUIRK and JAMEY KEATEN
articles.summary: Trump administration is leaving no stone unturned with its sweeping tariffs around the globe. Polar bear-inhabited islands affected by Trump tariffs include Norfolk Island, a former British penal colony and a tropical island with a leader befuddled by the situation there.
